formattedAddress: 29 E 8th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 29 E 8th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.

originalText.text:
I visited Subway in New York City in October 2023 and had the pleasure of trying their Veggie Patty sub, and I must say it was a delightful experience. As an Indian vegetarian, finding suitable food options while traveling can sometimes be a bit challenging, but Subway definitely came through.

The Veggie Patty sub was not only delicious but also offered a healthy alternative. The patty was flavorful and had a great texture, which is often hard to find in vegetarian options. I was impressed by the fresh vegetables and condiments that complemented the patty perfectly.

What stood out for me was the service and the staff's understanding of specific dietary preferences. They were attentive and made sure my sub was prepared just the way I liked it. It's always a relief to find a place that respects the dietary choices of its customers.

Subway's New York City location provided a clean and welcoming environment, making my meal even more enjoyable. I left feeling satisfied and grateful to have found a suitable, tasty, and healthy meal option. I would highly recommend Subway to fellow Indian vegetarians and anyone looking for a satisfying and customizable dining experience. Thank you, Subway, for catering to various dietary needs!

originalText.text:
(Updated 2019)

Understocked, understaffed, and overpriced and refuse coupons because it's not the right day or they're not allowing them anymore or they have a "deal" going on for an item but when I pay its the same price. Cashier on Wednesday is also rude af.

Update: Came back to get a salad because it’s quick and nearby to where I was, a chopped chicken Caesar salad. Didn’t think it’d be a problem, because I’ve gotten it at other Subways and have been wholly satisfied with the quality. Was horrendous compared to the other ones. Not only did they skimp on the dressing to barely cover a corner, the chicken looked mangled and destroyed, the tomatoes tasted bruised, wasn’t even chopped, and they didn’t seem to care for croutons that usually came with the salad. (Pictured) Their sandwiches are usually alright, not great, but I don’t know what happened here.

originalText.text: Kedwin restored my faith in the subways brand. For the first time in a subways restaurant I experienced great customer service and a well put together sandwich. Kedwin needs to be out here training all subway employees if the brand Hope's to survive!!!

text.text: Kedwin restored my faith in the subways brand. For the first time in a subways restaurant I experienced great customer service and a well put together sandwich. Kedwin needs to be out here training all subway employees if the brand Hope's to survive!!!

originalText.text: It’s raining outside and the floor is really muddy and gross. A customer knocked over the cup lids and the lids were on the floor everywhere. The subway guy just picked these dirty lids up and put them back on the shelf, as if they were not on the gross muddy ground a second ago. There’s other unpleasant experience I had here earlier but those are not comparable to this. I will warn everyone: the customer service is horrible, the hygiene condition is so bad, and I overheard that they 1. don’t take coupons 2. suspiciously charge higher just one day after a precious customer bought the same item
